issue.title: auth.securebanklogin.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://auth.securebanklogin.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fauth.securebanklogin.com%2F) ### Comment > When attempting to login to this banking page, with AdGuard enabled, after submitting my username and password, sometimes I'm unable to go beyond the login page, and the page resets my credentials multiple times. > > After clearing cookie cache and restarting browser, I'm able to go beyond credential page (sometimes) and then I get to the 2FA page. After entering 2FA, and clicking on Verify, immediately something is being blocked afterwards and I'm returned to the original login page and it gets stuck again. PS. I'm using Librewolf browser with maximum security settings. I'm able to login fine with AdGuard disabled extension enabled. Right now, I do NOT have the APP installed, just the extension. ### Screenshots

labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock professional company.
Ad-Shield receives up to 700 000 000 KRW per 2 year from tech foundation support program of South Korean government.

These records can be verified at [here](https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues?q=label%3Aad-shield+).
You can check the fact that support of South Korean government at [here](https://www.venturesquare.net/857777).

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [microShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/blob/main/README.md).


## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/issues).
Please report to [here](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/166924) if other issue.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/178790

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/178790

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/178790

issue.title: winfuture.de

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock professional company.
Ad-Shield receives up to 700 000 000 KRW per 2 year from tech foundation support program of South Korean government.

These records can be verified at [here](https://github.com/List-KR/List-KR/issues?q=label%3Aad-shield+).
You can check the fact that support of South Korean government at [here](https://www.venturesquare.net/857777).

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [microShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://community.list-kr.com/docs/AdGuard/Userscripts/microShield.

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/microShield/issues).
Please report to [here](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/180595) if other issue.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/178790

issue.title: ipass.cma.org.sa
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://ipass.cma.org.sa/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fipass.cma.org.sa%2F) ### Comment > Unfortunately, after latest updates I start to face a lot of issues while AdGuard is enabled. A lot of websites either not opening or needs to refresh the page multiple times to get it works. Keep in mind that I’ve not changed anything recently either in my WIN11 OS, BitDefender AntiVirus or AdGuard itself, and everything was totally working fine previously. > For example, https://ipass.cma.org.sa/ if AG is enabled the website won’t open at all. comment.body:
As far as I can see only some elements cannot be selected and it looks like that it's done on purpose, so I'm not sure if it should be fixed.

You can add:
```adblock
open.spotify.com#$#[draggable] { user-select: auto!important;-webkit-touch-callout: default!important;-webkit-user-select: auto!important;-moz-user-select: auto!important;-ms-user-select: auto!important; }
```
or
```adblock
open.spotify.com#$#* { user-select: auto!important;-webkit-touch-callout: default!important;-webkit-user-select: auto!important;-moz-user-select: auto!important;-ms-user-select: auto!important; }
```
to user rules.

Unfortunately, I can't create an account there. A foreign phone number is required.
Is it related to filters, stealth mode or DNS?
As I see, you wrote that you can log in fine in the Safari, but not in Firefox. Try to disable its ETP (Enhanced Tracking Protection) and check the site.

Advanced protection is only for Safari.
Telegram can only use DNS block and ads/popups are often implemented via normal HTML on the same page.

issue.title: myaccount.google.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://myaccount.google.com/find-your-phone](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmyaccount.google.com%2Ffind-your-phone) ### Comment > Using Google's find my device webpage with adguard enabled prevents contact from being made. Locating the phone on my laptop (windows 11, using chrome with uBlock installed) with adguard still enabled on phone works correctly so actual find my device service works as intended with adguard. Webpage to only fails to work when adguard was enabled on initial loading of the page. Ie. If adguard is OFF when page loads, then adguard is enabled, then the on page reload is pressed, phone status can still be updated Username: `@Bataling` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
In the case of `open.spotify.com` it looks like that text selection is blocked on "draggable"/"clickable" elements, so that's why I'm not sure if it should be fixed.

>Now I'm not sure if it is even worth reporting text selection blockage annoyances as it looks like you consider most of the cases out of scope.

It depends on the website and we have "a lot" of rules to unblock text selection. As I recall it's second or third case where I'm not sure if it should be fixed.

> @Zeop87 During testing I noticed that if I use AdGuard's built-in DNS server, the unblocking rules don't work. This is most likely a bug. You can try to create a personal DNS server using https://adguard-dns.io/ and unblock this domain in the server settings. You can follow the iOS development team's response in this repository: [AdguardTeam/AdguardForiOS#2365](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForiOS/issues/2365)

@jellizaveta 
Ok thank it work with personal dns server .

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/178790

comment.body: @Zeop87 During testing I noticed that if I use AdGuard's built-in DNS server, the unblocking rules don't work. This is most likely a bug. You can try to create a personal DNS server using https://adguard-dns.io/ and unblock this domain in the server settings. You can follow the iOS development team's response in this repository: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForiOS/issues/2365
